page.title: 04HOUSING.
page.content: This area of Southminster comprises mainly three bedroomed semi-detached houses although there are a few larger houses and some bungalows. In the District Plan mention is made of the need for more small houses for the elderly and also larger family homes. Just under half of the houses have been built within the last twenty whilst a few are over 100 years old. All the more modern houses are constructed of brick with tiled roofs though many of them have the brick covered with pebble dash or paint. None of the houses are made of stone since this is not a naturial material to Essex but many of the older houses are made of traditional lap board and have slate roofs. Recently there has been a revival of pargetting.(decorated plasterwork) There is very little thatch.
